projects.name: freeCodeCamp Responsive Web Design
projects.description: A series of web page projects that validate proficiency in HTML and CSS, as well as test for knowledge in semantic HTML, mobile responsiveness, and advanced styling like animations.

projects.name: Sports Arbitrage System
projects.description: A Python program that scrapes major betting platforms and detects arbitrage opportunities. Such opportunities exist when the odds of a certain team winning a game are different enough on separate platforms that guranteed money can be made by betting one team to win on one site and their opponent to win on the other.

projects.name: Look Alive
projects.description: A web application similar to the 'Hedbanz' game, where users take turns pointing the screen away from themselves, and the remaining players on the team provide hints so the player can guess the word.

projects.name: Game of Risk Network Model
projects.description: A Python application that applies graph theory in a digital version of 'Risk', complete with an automatically updating display of the game board. Users also have the option of facing a rule-based agent acting as a computer player.

projects.name: Cryptocurrency Trading Algorithm
projects.description: A Python program that can be scheduled to periodically buy or sell cryptocurrency on the FTX exchange. It operates based on a momentum strategy involving moving averages.

projects.name: Pocket Movie
projects.description: A recurrent neural network model trained on movie scripts that can write a new movie with a genre of the user's choice. In addition, it applies a Markov chain to improve the fluency of the script.

projects.name: Max Flow with NetworkX
projects.description: A Python client that maintains a data structure of a directed graph, and can leverage either a breadth-first search or Dijkstra's algorithm to compute the maximum flow of the graph. There are also utilities included for analyzing the run time and efficiency of these different algorithms.
